semantic_identifier: 2: feat: issue_clustering v2: Add post-cluster split-suggestion job + persistence + internal API

sections.text:
## Description

Implements an issue_clustering v2 post-processing step that detects overly broad clusters and generates persisted split suggestions for triage review.

What this PR adds:
- Post-clustering job (`GenerateClusterSplitSuggestionsJob`) executed after a clustering run completes.
- “Too broad” detection using configurable heuristics/metrics:
  - Cluster size threshold
  - Intra-cluster cohesion (avg/percentile pairwise similarity vs centroid)
  - Dispersion (distance-to-centroid spread)
  - Topic entropy (from top-N token/topic distribution)
  - A combined score + boolean `too_broad` flag with stored thresholds used
- Candidate split generation for flagged clusters:
  - Runs a lightweight sub-clustering on members (k chosen via bounded sweep + silhouette/score heuristic; capped to avoid heavy compute)
  - Produces 2..K child cluster proposals with per-child metrics (size, cohesion/dispersion, top terms)
  - Selects representative examples per proposed child cluster (top conversations/issues closest to child centroid)
- Persistence model/storage:
  - New DB records to store: parent cluster id, run id, metrics snapshot, split proposals, and representative example ids
  - Idempotent upsert keyed by (run_id, parent_cluster_id) so re-runs don’t duplicate suggestions
- Internal API surface:
  - Read endpoints to fetch split suggestions by run/cluster, including metrics + examples, without re-running clustering
  - Payload shaped for the triage UI (parent summary, `too_broad` reason(s), ordered proposals)

Operational notes:
- Thresholds and caps are configurable (env/config) and default to conservative values (medium priority: safe + incremental).
- Job is designed to be bounded (limits clusters analyzed and max sub-cluster K) and logs metrics for observability.
- No UI changes in this PR; it only persists and exposes data for the triage UI to consume.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
